items.title: Sr. Professional Services Consultant - 14434BR at Synopsys (Boston, MA) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Industry: Hardware, Software Development
Company size: 10k+ people
Company type: Public

Job description

Location: Anywhere in the USA

Why not work for the best in technology?


SYNOPSYS is revolutionizing the development of secure and reliable software. SYNOPSYS Software Integrity Consultants partner with clients who are making technology breakthroughs such as the Curiosity Mars Rover and Large Hadron Collider.


As a SYNOPSYS Consultant, you would lead customers to success in three key areas:

  • Solution design: You engage with the world’s leading technology companies to understand their business needs and solve critical problems concerning software quality and security
  • Solution delivery: You are involved from project initiation to completion with end-to-end ownership of successful results
  • Expert consulting: You become an advisor to our customers providing solution expertise in the domain of software testing and security

To become a SYNOPSYS Consultant, you need:

  • Proven technical aptitude, sharp consulting instincts and a passion for delivering groundbreaking solutions for top tier technology companies
  • Ability to thrive in a demanding environment with clients who have high expectations
  • At least 5 years of technology consulting experience, preferably in software testing and/or application security
  • Preferred candidates will have security certifications such as CEH, CISSP and CSSLP
  • At least 3 years of experience developing in C/C++, Java, C# or other major programming language.
  • Expert knowledge of various software development process models and with procedural and object oriented programming concepts.
  • Strong scripting ability in one or more common scripting languages (Perl, Python, Ruby, shell).
  • Knowledge of build systems and software development tools
  • BS or MS degree in computer science, engineering or other scientific degree
  • Open to travel to customer sites

About Synopsys

Synopsys offers the most comprehensive portfolio of software security solutions in the market. We go beyond traditional testing services to help our clients identify, remediate, and prevent vulnerabilities in the applications that power their business. Our holistic approach to application security offers a balance of managed and professional services and products tailored to fit your specific needs. We don’t stop when the test is over. Our experts also provide remediation guidance, program design services, and training that empower you to build and maintain secure applications.

Benefits

Unlimited PTO
Medical, Dental, Vision
401(k)
Commuter program
Performance bonus
Competitive salaries
Tuition reimbursement
Gym membership reimbursement
Employee stock purchase program

items.title: Can you decode me? ...cmUncyB0aGUgam9... at BigJump Limited (Worcester, UK) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer, Backend Developer
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private

Job description

You like a challenge? Great! Here's the job description :D



Skills & Requirements

NO AGENCIES OR JOB BOARDS PLEASE !!! 

About BigJump Limited

Founded over 14 years ago, we provide high quality technical consulting, bespoke development and product development.

Working for some of the worlds most well-known brands, we are lucky enough to have the option to use the latest and greatest tools and technologies.  We are seriously into CI/CD and the general DevOps mentality, striving to automate whenever possible.

We are an independent, enthusiastic and hard working team, based in both Worcester and Bromsgrove, near Birmingham. You can see sheep from our office and work buys everyone lunch down the pub on a Friday.

We are pretty flexible when it comes to working from home and some remote working, but we would like to see peoples faces at least once per week.  

PLEASE NOTE

  • You MUST be eligible to work in the UK to apply for this position.
  • NO AGENCIES

Benefits

iPads For Developers
Flexible Working Hours
Herman Miller Chairs
No Dress Code
Resharper
Windows and Macs
Fresh Fruit
Company Lunches

items.title: Small Firm Technology Leader (Remote) at Dorsia Investment Group LLC () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior, Lead, Manager
Industry: Finance
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Our firm

We’re a small investment firm in New York, run by two quants. Even though we’ve been trading stocks successfully since 2012, we have never hired anybody to help – we have done all the strategy, trading, and technology ourselves. Our focus is on the investment strategy, but we are good coders and have built a solid infrastructure for a two-man operation.

Now it’s time to take off, and we’re hiring a small team to expand the business.

Here’s where you come in—

We need a top notch tech guru to lead the entire tech of our firm as we expand. Think of it as a CTO type role – you will report directly to the founders. You’d have a wide range of skills (enterprise IT admin, app dev) and be managing everything – from finding the right enterprise solutions as we expand, to extending our Python quantitative backend infrastructure, to managing databases, networks and permissions. Everything technology-related will be under your purview. And at least initially, you will be the only person on our team focused on tech full-time.

Our culture is casual with a start-up feel. We care deeply about efficiency and robust tech, but not how you choose to manage your schedule. We care about our lifestyles but don’t want to dictate yours. You’ll be working remotely but will have constant access to the founders, who will give you feedback and growth.

Ideal candidate would have:

  • Top notch coding skills. You will need to be able write robust, clean code with a focus on extensibility and performance. We use Python throughout, but as tech lead you might decide e.g. Java/C++ is more suitable for a particular solution.
  • Experience with hedge fund technology (managing positions, broker data, market data, etc.) a big plus.
  • Experience with databases and managing data.
  • Experience with configuring and permissioning enterprise apps for a growing organization.
  • Experience with integration of back-end systems with Excel. Currently we use PyXLL, a cool system that integrates a Python backend with Excel.
  • Strong communication skills and ability to work remotely and manage your own schedule.
  • Creativity and being highly proactive in your solutions, passion about tech and coding, and staying well-informed of cool new solutions for tech problems.

Benefits

Remote Work

items.title: Progress / Openedge Senior Developer /Consultant To 60K - Eclipse Total Solutions Limited - Home Based
items.content:
Progress / Openedge Senior Developer /Consultant To 60K
Eclipse Total Solutions Limited -Home Based
Permanent
With Clients in the UK, Ireland and Europe our award winning client are looking to expand their brilliant team with traditional developers who enjoy their tech.

Hands on, with an eye for detail and 'get the job done right 1st time' attitude individuals are requested to apply.

You must posses the 'core' progress values, yet understand the latest technologies as well as be able to work under pressure.

items.title: Growth hacker
items.content:
Hi there! We're a digital marketing agency that works with awesome b2c and b2b clients.

Looking for a full-time growth hacker who's a great writer and doer (you'll be staffed on 1-3 client accounts at a time). You're happiest when building landing pages, prospecting for leads and setting up an outbound cold email campaign, or hustling for affiliates. It's the right fit if you live in Slack / Trello / Gmail, are hyper-organized and detail oriented, and have previous experience working remotely.

M-F schedule, although happy to accommodate some flexibility during the day as well as shifting some work to the weekend. Not the right fit if you're a full-on digital nomad with a busy travel schedule but definitely feel free to work from the beach :-D.

Profile:
-- Analytical: you make decisions based on data (e.g. A/B tests) and know where to find the metrics you need
-- Explore new acquisition opportunities including paid acquisition, SEO, email marketing, and website optimization
-- Evaluate tracking and attribution strategies to come up with data-driven decisions that drive growth performance evaluation
-- Work with our in-house design team to prioritize and manage ongoing creative and audience testing
-- Experience with Facebook, Google AdWords, and other major advertising channels
-- Experience building landing page and web optimization tools like Optimizely

Compensation:
$1600-2400 per month depending on experience.

items.title: Fuel Made: Ecommerce Growth Strategist
items.content:
Full-time

(Western North America)

A few years ago we here at Fuel Made were just a small handful of folks focused on building the very best ecommerce experiences on the web. Leading out with strong design, exceptional client experiences, and deep Shopify expertise we delighted our clients, and grew our agency. Our approach led to success, and opportunities we couldn’t have imagined.

Today, our clients are successful, established merchants with specialized shops and complex needs. The opportunity to service these clients is challenging and exciting.

We are seeking an experienced ecommerce growth strategist to serve as the expert guide for our clients. We are looking for someone who understands ecommerce and its associated KPIs, understands what it means to be data-driven and understands how to drive growth. You should also be exceptionally good at communicating all of this with clients as a trusted adviser. 

In this position you will work with our team, and directly with our clients. You will be the primary driver throughout each project directing the solutions we build. You'll also be working with our existing clients to provide ongoing advice and recommendations to help them grow. Our client's growth will be your #1 responsibility. You should have the experience and know-how to make that happen.

This is a serious responsibility, and an exciting one. Watching your hard work come to life and watching our customer’s delight as it impacts their bottom line is rewarding. This is why we love ecommerce.

Most of our clients have not heavily focused on optimization and improvement of key metrics, and we have a unique opportunity to both educate them, and blow them away with what's possible with systematic testing and improvement over time.

You: 

  • At least two years of, specifically, ecommerce growth experience 
  • Experience moving ecommerce-specific KPIs (e.g. CAC, AOV, RPC, CR, CLTV)
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
  • Willingness to do things The Right Way (especially when it's hard)
  • Data nerd
  • CRO expert
  • Desire to learn (curiosity)
  • Passion for all things ecommerce, you are abreast of industry best practices and evolution.
  • Easy and enjoyable to work with
  • Self-motivated

Why you might like working for us:

  • We choose our clients carefully. 
  • Freedom to care about your work (we're focused on quality)
  • Freedom to own projects from a strategy standpoint
  • Freedom to focus and get really good at what you do (we're focused 100% on ecommerce)
  • We work reasonable hours.
  • The care we have for our clients is rivaled only by the care we have for each other. We are a tight-knit, professional team who care a lot about doing world-class work together.

Benefits:

  • Vacation: two weeks paid vacation (available from the day you start) plus 7 paid holidays, and we also take off the week between Christmas and New Years.
  • Remote work: Western North America is your office.
  • Health care benefits. 
  • Yearly retreat: Each year we all gather as a team somewhere fun (and warm!) to connect, learn, and have a lot of fun together.
  • Tools: we'll make sure you have whatever software and hardware you need to do your job.
  • Location: We are a fully remote company, but you must be in North America, and located in the Pacific or Mountain time zones, available to work regular business hours every day.

Location: We are a fully remote company, but you must be in North America, and located in the Pacific or Mountain time zones, available to work regular business hours every day.

Apply:

items.title: Seeking Several Senior Microsoft Access Consultants (Virtual/Onsite)
items.content:
Seeking Several Senior Microsoft Access Consultants 
(Virtual/Onsite) hide this posting  unhide 
< image 1 of 2 >  <https://images.craigslist.org/00303_l8Pdafy4gO9_600x450.jpg>
 <https://images.craigslist.org/00C0C_gFMOCVyIUtG_600x450.jpg> 245 Park Avenue 
 (google map 
<https://maps.google.com/?q=loc%3A+%32%34%35+Park+Avenue+New+York+City+NY+US>) 

compensation: $50-$65 an hour 
employment type: contract 
telecommuting okay 


QR Code Link to This Post
 Hello,

 Please read this entire page. At the bottom there is a link which will take 
you to the application.

 Applicants living within 2 hours from the following metropolitan cities given 
preference:

 New York City
 Chicago
 Philadelphia
 Jacksonville
 Indianapolis
 Columbus.
 Charlotte
 Detroit
 Washington D.C.

 I truly, hope that this is the last job application posting you every have to 
read.

 My name is Sasha Froyland and I'm the founder of Help4Access.

 Over the past 8 years I've developed the world's best team of MS Access 
consultants working on a projects within the US. Most of us are located in the 
San Francisco Bay Area but we've grown and now we're ready to build a much 
stronger practice in the east coast where many of our larger projects are 
getting ready to start.

 Here is a just a sample of our team:
https://www.help4access.com/our-team/ <https://www.help4access.com/our-team/>

 Why join our team?
 Answer: You'll get to leverage the power the team's combined 200+ years of 
experience and be assigned consistent, high value, interesting projects. In a 
nutshell, you'll enjoy a higher quality of life.

 Everyone on the team is 20+ senior and before joining Help4Access they had 
developed their own book of business, their own small consulting practice. So, 
everyone is not only very technical, but they are also great communicators and 
quickly build rapport with our valued clients.

 Secondly, you'll learn cool stuff. We're very focused on helping our largest 
clients develop/extend the original functionality of their complex Microsoft 
Access applications to mobile, web and the cloud.

 Here's a cool video where we show Microsoft Access running on the iPad, 
iPhone and in the cloud.
https://www.help4access.com/access-database-mobile-iphone-ipad-cloud/ 
<https://www.help4access.com/access-database-mobile-iphone-ipad-cloud/>

 We've developed some really cool tools to help programmatically perform much 
of the heavy lifting when migrating Microsoft Access applications to other 
technologies such as SQL Sever, Oracle, ASP dot NET, Java and more. These tools 
and techniques are constantly evolving to fit our customer's need.

 See how we helped Albertsons/Safeway manage over 65,000 MS Access databases:
https://www.help4access.com/ms-access-risk-mitigation-pt1/ 
<https://www.help4access.com/ms-access-risk-mitigation-pt1/>

 I'm sorry if this sounds like a sales pitch, I'm just very excited about our 
mission and what we've accomplished.

 In fact, that's another reason why Help4Access is good for you. This is it: 
sales, marketing, legal, billing, collections, business development. Yip, you 
never have to do it again! You get to stay focused on what you like to do and 
that is add value by writing great MS Access desktop database applications. 
Staying focused on what you like to do is how you get great. Help4Access helps 
you focus on your core strengths which is one big reason why the team at 
Help4Access is the best in the world. It really cannot be done any other way.

 About you:
 You should be fairly self sufficient with your current clients or perhaps 
semi-retired. On-boarding at Help4Access can be a slow process. Let me backup. 
My goal with every consultant is to keep them booked as much as they would like 
to be booked.

 Some consultants need 40+ hours a week, while other consultants prefer 8 to 
16 hours a week or seasonal.

 So, when I when I land a new project, I match the client's expectations with 
a consultant's needs. I like to think of it as a cadence or a dance. All 
parties must be aligned and start off on the right foot.

 I don't take on small projects or high risk clients. Many of our largest 
clients have life-time projects requiring 20-30 hours a week forever. All 
remote work completed from your home office over your fast internet but face to 
face meetings with your accounts from time to time may be required. You must be 
available during normal business hours for phone calls and meetings. This is 
not the kind of work you can do in addition to a full-time job.

 So back to on boarding. Once you join, your first project will be light. I'll 
be organizing the meetings between you and the client and attending the 
meetings to see how you do. Then, the projects you'll be assigned will be 
larger and more complex as I gain confidence in your skills and style.

 We support the world's most complex MS Access applications. One of our larger 
clients has 50,000 users leveraging data centers in San Francisco, Chicago and 
India running 24x7 with call centers in all three area. The database holds 
critical life support data. All on Microsoft Access to SQL Server.

 We get some simple projects too, but I want you to have a feel for the level 
of complexity you should expect to grow into being able to handle if you want 
long term high numbers of hours per week project assignments.

 Also, you must have SQL Server experience and basically be a development DBA, 
meaning, you can write stored procedures and debug them no problem. Also, would 
be great if you have touched Azure and double-great if you are comfortable 
developing in ASP dot NET. But some of this is not too important because we 
have a partners for hardcore DBA production work as well as large scale web and 
mobile development too.

 That's it. If you are not sure about joining Help4Access, I completely 
understand. Hopefully the above gives you kind of a career roadmap to becoming 
a world-class MS Access consultant (I prefer the title Solution Architect as 
appose to MS Access consultant. Google this: "togaf solution architecture 
definition").

 Here is the link to the online application. This link will take you to a page 
on our site where there is another link to a Google Form
https://www.help4access.com/ms-access-consultant-application/ 
<https://www.help4access.com/ms-access-consultant-application/>

 Please complete the online application and include a link to your LinkedIn 
profile (REQUIRED).

 I'll review your application and be back in touch via email within a week or 
two.

 If selected, the next step will be setting up a GoToMeeting meeting to get to 
know each-other and review a few applications you've developed. For the 
meeting/demo, please think about code reuse, table design, 3NF and how you've 
made enhancement suggestions to your clients which resulted in greater 
application stability and usability (I want to see if you can grow an account 
and keep the project moving).

 Kind regards,
 Sasha Froyland - Founder - Enterprise Architect
 San Francisco, CA
 www.linkedin.com/in/sashafroyland/ 
 * Principals only. Recruiters, please don't contact this job poster. 
 * do NOT contact us with unsolicited services or offers

items.title: Secret Benefits: Sick Of Polishing Turds?
items.content:
Sick Of Polishing Turds?

Posted Sep 29

Secret Benefits
Headquarters: The World
http://secretbenefits.com

Fed up trying to market a product that no one wants? Knowing that however much polish you add, it's still a turd? Or perhaps you're one of a 10-person marketing department where getting an idea tested requires more political acumen than creative genius? Or maybe you love your work but hate the commute, and the costs to your lifestyle?

Secret Benefits is a sugar dating site that users love, has no bureaucracy, and understands that life comes before work. We're only a young site but according to this user, we're doing OK:

"It’s fantastic!! Amazing like life changing! Thank you very much!! A very satisfied customer!!"

This testimonial's so glowing that I'd be foolish to make it up. I considered fixing the grammar but decided I liked the rawness. As a marketer, you understand that changing lives is a good start but there's more to success. We may have thousands of users but most people haven't heard of us, like you before seeing this curious job listing -- come help us change that. 

If you've got any experience getting the word out about a product, or in generating publicity, we want to hear from you. When you join, you'll make up 50% of our dedicated marketing team. You'll interact daily with the co-owners, and have your ideas live and tested almost as quickly as you come up with them. Spend time implementing, and reviewing your concepts, not waiting for them to be approved by 3 VPs.

We're a young, motivated team that's entirely remote and distributed globally. Sick of that commute, or reminding the in-person team that you're still alive? Here we're all in the same position. You dictate when and where you do the work -- fit it around your life without feeling guilty.

We know little about Social Media and PR. These are the two major gaps we're trying to fill. But if you've got experience in other areas like email marketing, PPC, branding, or anything else, we'd still love to hear from you.  

Apply for this position

To apply, please send your best proof of being able to help us to apply@secretbenefits.com Hint: A track record of success, particularly if it's in PR or social media, is what we're especially interested in.

items.title: Technical Consultant. Be the human face of software.
items.content:
*BASED IN THE USA*

*Content to be a small cog in a big wheel?* Then this isn’t for you.

*Keen to be a brand ambassador?* – the one clients come to for expert advice? Step this way.

*A well-established, investor-backed, software house.* We’re innovative, entrepreneurial, and collaborative. That means you won’t be bogged down in bureaucracy. You’ll be making a difference.

*We need a technical consultant* who’ll own every stage of solutions: from concept and design to development and delivery into client sites. And you’ll be just as confident and comfortable with clients and stakeholders as you are with ERP and BPO. We want a charismatic, clear-talking human being, not a humanoid.

*You have a technical background,* ideally as a programmer (C#.NET or Java), but you’ve moved into a consulting-type role. You’re articulate, engaging, and self-motivated. You’re a problem-solver, in business and in technology. You understand project management, the software development life cycle, and structured programming methods and controls.

*Day to day, you’ll be providing design-documented, supportable and extensible solutions.* And you’ll be supporting partners, clients, and fellow consultants. But this is no humdrum desk job. There’ll be domestic and international travel, but with significant scope for remote working – we value the work/life balance.

*On offer is a salary of up to USD $120,000 + excellent package + share options.* We look forward to hearing from you. And remember you don't fish without a hook. No resumes without a cover letter, please.
